Author: newvulcan#4719
Content: Just my two peneth. This might not work for you @Lumbi but it works on my install. If I find one of my chains isn't notarizing for a couple of cycles (I base this on the most succesful nodes at that time), then I first consolidate then clean then split. If that doesn't work after another couple of cycles, I kill the daemon for that chain and restart, without reindex (made that mistake once, won't do that again!!). It might decide to verify the chain which can take a while. Once its finished, I found there will be no difference unless I consolidate/clean and split again. Once I've done that it all works..Again it works for me. I managed top stop on the 6hr chart for a short while following that, and up into the top 5 on the 48hr chart. Then I f***** up by restarting KMD, forgetting I had -reindex set, and lost a day !!

Author: newvulcan#4719
Content: Have to say that because I work for myself and at home all day, I have the ability to keep a very close eye on things, so nothing is as yet automated, which I know is fine for the testnet, but not for the mainnet, so my method here wouldn't work in the real world

Author: newvulcan#4719
Content: Oh the only time I ever contemplate restarting KMD, is if nothing is notarizing - Fair point its a hammer to crack a nut method, but it works.

Author: newvulcan#4719
Content: I know I'm waffling, but here's a good example right now. My notarizing figures on the 6hr chart are 10,59,28 and I'm 6th. Around me I'm seeing figures of 10 for BEER, 20 and 28 for TXS and the odd 59 for PIZZA. So even though the current best performing node is And1-89 with 10,11,20, I'm not going to do anything at this point, as I appear to be notarizing fine, albeit not the fastest. And there you go, 10 minutes or so later, I was right to do nothing, and I'm cycling at the same rate as the current top 4 and up into 5th spot
